dt: {bc}the thing one intends to convey especially by language {bc}{sx|purport||}
{bc}the thing that is conveyed especially by language {bc}{sx|import||}

dt.t: Many words have more than one {wi}meaning{/wi}.

dt: {bc}implication of a hidden or special significance
{bc}the logical {d_link|connotation|connotation} of a word or phrase
{bc}the logical {d_link|denotation|denotation} or extension of a word or phrase

shortdef: the thing one intends to convey especially by language : purport
the thing that is conveyed especially by language : import

dt.t: When any mention was made of baronets either married or unmarried, of former lovers, of broken vows, or of second engagements, Miss Altifiorla would look with a {wi}meaning{/wi} glance at her hostess.
Ruby lifted her heavy-lidded eyes and sent him a {wi}meaning{/wi} look.

utxt.t: She said: "I am not a very plucky girl." She looked up at me and added {wi}meaningly{/wi}: "And {it}you{/it} know it. And you know why."
"I have come about a private matter," he said, looking {wi}meaningly{/wi} at Betty, who got up and began to move toward the door.

shortdef: conveying or intended to convey meaning : significant, meaningful

dt: {bc}to have in the mind as a purpose {bc}{sx|intend||}
sometimes used interjectionally with {it}I{/it}, chiefly in informal speech for emphasis
or to introduce a phrase restating the point of a preceding phrase

dt.t: we try to answer what we can, but I {wi}mean{/wi} we're not God

dt: {bc}to design for or {d_link|destine|destine} to a specified purpose or future
{bc}to serve or intend to {d_link|convey|convey}, show, or indicate {bc}{sx|signify||}
{bc}to have importance to the degree of

dt.t: His criticism was {it}meant{/it} for all of us.

quotes.t: Home {qword}meant{/qword} my father, with kind eyes, songs, and tense recitations for my brother and myself.

The season of backyard barbecues and lakeside cookouts is at hand, which in most parts of the country {qword}means{/qword} an orgy of grilled steaks, hamburgers and hot dogs lasting until Labor Day and beyond.

Even the water in the cave was free from surface contamination … which {qword}meant{/qword} that all the water now in Lechugilla percolated into the cave before the widespread nuclear bomb testing of the 1940s …

et: Middle English {it}menen{/it}, from Old English {it}mǣnan{/it}; akin to Old High German {it}meinen{/it} to have in mind, Old Church Slavonic {it}měniti{/it} to mention
shortdef: to have in the mind as a purpose : intend —sometimes used interjectionally with I, chiefly in informal speech for emphasis or to introduce a phrase restating the point of a preceding phrase
to design for or destine to a specified purpose or future
to serve or intend to convey, show, or indicate : signify

dt: {bc}the part of meaning that varies from one inflectional form to another (as from {it}plays{/it} to {it}played{/it} to {it}playing{/it}) {dx}compare {dxt|lexical meaning||}{/dx}

shortdef: the part of meaning that varies from one inflectional form to another (as from plays to played to playing)

dt: {bc}the meaning of the base (such as the word {it}play{/it}) in a paradigm (such as {it}plays, played, playing{/it}) {dx}compare {dxt|grammatical meaning||}{/dx}

shortdef: the meaning of the base (such as the word play) in a paradigm (such as plays, played, playing)

stems: know the meaning of the word

dt: {bc}to understand (something) because one has experienced it

dt.t: Those people don't {it}know the meaning of{/it} hard work.

dt: often used in an exaggerated way to make a forceful statement

dt.t: He doesn't {it}know the meaning of{/it} fear.
I'll never stop trying. I don't {phrase}know the meaning of the word{/phrase} "failure."

shortdef: to understand (something) because one has experienced it —often used in negative statements —often used in an exaggerated way to make a forceful statement
